content.rendered:
Holly and Adam celebrated their marriage with a late spring wedding featuring romantic florals, soft pink details, and a stunning view of Nashville at The Bridge Building. 

These two first met at the University of Tennessee - Knoxville and dated almost five years before Adam popped the question after a sweet dinner in their downtown condo!

When it was time to start planning their wedding, it was important that it felt like a big, stress-free party with an “overall awesome guest experience.” Safe to say that’s what they got!

On the big day, the couple shared a sweet first look under the pedestrian bridge before the ceremony. That didn’t stop Adam from shedding a tear as Holly walked down the aisle in her modern off-the-shoulder gown with her embroidered veil and classic white bouquet. 

After Holly and Adam exchanged their vows, guests found their way to a cocktail hour to sip on chardonnay as the couple took more photos just before the sunset.

The Cumberland space was set with alternating floral arrangements and white candles at the center of each table with ivory and blush linens and antique driftwood chairs. The chic decor and romantic ambiance of glowing string lights really set the tone.

After a delicious plated dinner service, Holly and Adam kicked off a night full of fun and dancing with their first dance to “Your Song” by Elton John. 

Scroll on to see more details of their chic, romantic wedding at The Bridge Building!

WEDDING DETAILS

Date: May 14th, 2021
Bride & Groom: Holly and Adam
Location: The Bridge Building
Guest Count: 160
Colors: Rose Gold and White
Photographer: John Myers Photography
Florist: LMA Designs
Dress: The Bride Room
Suit: Jos A. Banks
Hair & Makeup: One10 Beauty
Paper Goods: Dear Addie
Cake: Nashville Sweets
Linens: Event Works
DJ: Emerald Empire Band
Catering & Bar: The Bridge Building
Production Design: Nashville Lighting & Production
Planning: Emily | IH

excerpt.rendered: A chic wedding style with romantic flare at the Bridge Building.
